p: China has a long history of recording significant political and natural events for over 3000 y. Medium- or large-sized mammals, including panda, elephant, rhino, tiger, and others, were important attractions owing to their economic value, declarative usage, or conflict with humans. Sightings of these large animals, reports of humanâ€“animal conflicts, or gifts to the emperor and captures of these animals were frequently recorded in Chinese historical literature. Wen ( 16) compiled a compendium of historical distributions of some endangered mammal species by extracting original records from official or formally documented histories (e.g., Twenty-Four Histories, Comprehensive Mirror, and Aid in Government) and local gazetteers (provincial, prefectural, and district gazetteers), which provide an opportunity for reconstructing the local extinction of these mammals over past millennia.
